intro: Heracleum lanatum subsp. akasimontanum, commonly known as the Akasimon tarragon or Akasimon hogweed, is a member of the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its tall, branched stems and large, compound leaves that can reach up to 1 meter in length. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers in umbrella-like clusters, typical of the carrot family. It is native to the Caucasus region and thrives in moist, temperate climates. Due to its toxic sap, it requires caution when handling.
